description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f8ds7","text":"Trypsin digestion of isolated proteins using S-trap Spin columns in preparation for downstream proteomic profiling. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Trypsin Digestion, S-trap spin columns, Proteomics, Mass Spectrometry
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"4hp47","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f603v","text":"S-trap spin columns (Protifi)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"447v4","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coqm6","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3s62","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t1os","text":"Centrifugal vacuum concentrator","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h1jc","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"doviu","text":"Small hot box/incubator","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85m","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sup5","text":"HPLC-grade water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1nnp","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51r6v","text":"10% SDS solution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n1en","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9eb9","text":"1 M triethylamonium bicarbonate (TEAB) solution, pH 8","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92ija","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r8gc","text":"100 mM triethylamonium bicarbonate (TEAB) solution, pH 8 in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b977","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vkfo","text":"Dithiothreitol (DTT; 250 mM in 100 mM TEAB, pH 8)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6orv","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee8s0","text":"Iodoacetamide (IAA; 250 mM in 100 mM TEAB, pH 8)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16npe","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v6qj","text":"S-trap buffer (90% methanol in 100 mM TEAB)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"diab3","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek934","text":"Sequencing-grade trypsin","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12fje","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5v4o","text":"12% phosphoric acid in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n779","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3fqe","text":"Digestion buffer/Elution buffer 1: 50 mM triethylamonium bicarbonate (TEAB) solution, pH 8 in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b60j0","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jqm6","text":"Elution buffer 2: 0.5% formic acid (FA) in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lpsf","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0cst","text":"Elution buffer 3: 50% acetonitrile (ACN), 0.5% formic acid (FA) in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ef3ma","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eforr","text":"0.2% formic acid (FA) in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eid79","text":"

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7gndr","text":"In a 2-mL microcentrifuge tube add up to 300 μg of the protein lysate, 10% SDS for a final concentration of 4% SDS, 1M TEAB pH 8 solution for a final concentration of 50 mM TEAB, and HPLC-grade water if necessary to bring the volume up to a minimum of 50 µL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f9hoj","text":"Add 250 mM DTT for a final concentration of 20 mM and incubate for 10min at 50°C to reduce the proteins. Then immediately leave for 10 min on the bench at room temperature (RT).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4i6tq","text":"Add 250 mM IAA for a final concentration of 40 mM and incubate for 30min at RT in the dark to alkylate the proteins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5r9","text":"Acidify the sample with 12% phosphoric acid for a final concentration of 1.2%. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1f3dr","text":"Add 7 volumes of S-Trap buffer to the acidified lysate and mix immediately by inversion. Formation of protein colloid may be observed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4abp4","text":"Use S-trap micro spin columns for ≤ 100 μg of protein or S-trap mini spin columns for 100-300 µg of protein. Ensure that the S-Trap spin column is in a 2.0-mL flow-through catch tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23jd","text":"Add 100 μL (S-trap micro spin column) or 200 μL (S-trap mini spin column) of the acidified lysate/S-Trap buffer mix into the S-Trap spin column. Centrifuge at 4,000 x g for 10 seconds or until all the solution has passed through the column. Discard the flow-though.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":167,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4veb7","text":"Repeat step 7 until the entire acidified lysate and S-Trap buffer mix has passed through the column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ouh7","text":"Add 200 μL (S-trap micro spin column) or 400 μL (S-trap mini spin column) of S-Trap buffer to wash the column. Centrifuge at 4,000 x g for 10 seconds or until all solution has passed through the column. Discard the wash solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":133,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7lfa","text":"Add 200 μL (S-trap micro spin column) or 400 μL (S-trap mini spin column) of S-Trap buffer and set aside. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e27cg","text":"Centrifuge the S-trap spin column at 4,000 x g for 10 seconds or until the column is dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ddd7l","text":"Place the S-Trap spin column into a clean 2.0-mL elution tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"210s4","text":"Loosely cap the S-trap micro spin column or close the S-trap mini spin column and incubate for 1 hour at 47°C with no agitation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1n058","text":"After 1 hour, add another 125 μL of the sequencing-grade trypsin solution to the column and incubate overnight at 37°C with no agitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ech8f","text":"a.     Add 80 μL of elution buffer 1 (50 mM TEAB, pH 8) and centrifuge at 1,000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":82,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tpff","text":"After overnight incubation take the samples out of the incubator and elute sequentially in the same 2.0-mL elution tube as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1820d","text":"b.     Add 80 μL of elution buffer 2 (0.5% FA) and centrifuge at 1,000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":73,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28d1b","text":"c.     Add 80 μL of elution buffer 3 (50% ACN, 0.5% FA) and centrifuge at 4,000 x g for 1 minute. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":82,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2phbi","text":"Vacuum dry the eluted peptide solution in a centrifugal vacuum concentrator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2s14n","text":"Reconstitute the dried peptides in 0.2% FA and thoroughly mix the solution before desalting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"t7vb","text":"Add 125 μL of the sequencing-grade trypsin solution to the column at a 1:25 (wt/wt) trypsin/protein ratio. Be careful not to pierce the trap material.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h1ao","text":"Prepare a 1:25 (wt/wt) trypsin/protein ratio solution of sequencing-grade trypsin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Protein Digestion with S-trap Spin Columns
